refnamediv.refpurpose: Render a Rivendell log as a single audio file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: rdrender1 can be used to render an existing Rivendell log as a single audio WAV file.

listitem.para: Use chans channels in the output file. If not given, 2 channels (stereo) will be used.
Start the rendered file with line lineno. This option is mutually exclusive with the --first-time option, below.
Start the rendered file with the event having a hard-start time of HH:MM:SS. This option is mutually exclusive with the --first-line option, above.
Treat any STOP transitions encountered as if they were PLAY. If not given, a STOP transition will cause rendering of the log to be terminated at that point.
End the rendered file with line lineno-1. This option is mutually exclusive with the --last-time option, below.
End the rendered file with the event immediately prior to the one having a hard-start time of HH:MM:SS. This option is mutually exclusive with the --last-line option, above.
Render the log as if it had been started at a time of HH:MM:SS. (Useful for ensuring that dayparted carts play as expected). If not given, the current system time will be used.
Be verbose. Among other things, this will cause rdrender1 to print a disposition for each log event encountered to standard error.
